bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Trinity Baptist Church was established in 1875. During the church's first two years, congregants met at Ridgewood Hall on Broadway in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn. In 1877, Trinity's chapel opened, located on Greene Avenue between Patchen Avenue and Broadway in Bedford-Stuyvesant. The majority of the founding congregation was comprised of members from the Willoughby Avenue Baptist Church.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of one ledger, dated 1874 to 1915 and measuring one linear foot. The ledger contains a membership roll of the Trinity Baptist Church, listing member names, baptism dates, dates of acceptance to and dismissal from the church, and member addresses.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Records of the Willoughby Avenue Baptist Church, Trinity Baptist Church's predecessor, are also available at the Brooklyn Historical Society, collection 1985.083.
